intro: Tracheliopsis albicans, commonly known as the white tracheliopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to certain regions of southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking low-maintenance, drought-tolerant plants.
